content.description: Climb 20' up a flared offwidth to a ledge, a bit grainy and exfoliating. This section narrows in the back to take #3 and #4 camalots and is the crux.  From the ledge you can enter the cave and climb up a fun chimney (5.2?) on solid rock to the top of the formation - may be bird crap in this section.  Recommended to place a #5 cam early after entering the cave to prevent the rope from getting jammed into the cave entrance.  From the ledge you can also continue straight up instead of entering the cave but the rock quality looked suspect.  At the top you may need to go back a ways to find a good place for an anchor.  Walk over to Soft Cell to rap off.
content.location: 50' right of Death of a Decade

content.description: From the first bolt of Soft Cell move right and climb a steep slab  up to a horizontal crack, then traverse left along the crack to the Soft Cell 2-bolt anchor.
content.protection: 2-bolt anchor (less than 80 foot rappel). I used two #3 camaolts in the horizontal crack for directionals.

climbs.name: Soft Cell
climbs.fa: Mike Paul, Malcom Best, Charles Cole, 1980's

content.description:
Steep slab climbing on quality tan-colored rock with fair to good protection makes this well protected for Joshua Tree standards, but it's not a sport climb.

The fun moves, easy approach and lack of traffic make this a climb to seek out when in the vicinity. Three stars out of five.

Begin about 150 ft up and right from

Death Of A Decade

(5.10a). A crackless dihedral to slab.
This is an interesting steep face route near the middle of the east face of Hunk Rock.  The moves are much more of a mental challenge than a physical one.  This climb receives early morning sun.
content.location: Middle of the east face of Hunk Rock.

content.description:
Climb up a low angle crack in a right facing open book capped by a block.  Tunnel under the block and climb the block on its back side to the top and a bolted anchor.

Note:  as of 12/2018 the anchor consisted of two rusted studs, no hangers.  Do not climb up the final block unless you are willing to downclimb it.
content.protection: gear to #4, gear anchor if not going to top of block, top of block has bolted anchor in poor condition
content.location: 50' right of Ten Years After, 20' left of Hunky Dory

content.description: This route starts on the east face of Hunk Rock and turns the left corner to finish up the unprotected south face. A serious fall could occur here after running it out past the first and only bolt on the route. If you're solid at the grade, there should be no problem as the bolt is placed at the crux of the route. The rock quality begins to degrade as you near the summit.
content.protection: Bring a selection of cams to make a belay at the top and 1 full length QD for the 1 bolt on the route.

climbs.name: Death of a Decade
climbs.fa: Bob Van Belle and Alan Nelson, 1979

content.description:
This is a very dynamic stemming route up an interesting left-facing dihedral just to the right of

Soft Cell

(5.10c/d). Lots of fun and a good workout. The rock quality is great and a decent is easyily made from the chains atop Soft Cell.
content.protection: There is a fixed pin and one bolt on the route.  Standard rack from 1/2" to 3".

climbs.name: Breath of Death
climbs.fa: Alan Nelson and Bob Van Belle, December 1979

content.description: This is a short but very nice crack route, with an overhanging, 3/4" wide crux.  It is in a shady location.
content.protection: Wide fingers to hands sized pieces.
content.location: Fifty yards right of Death of a Decade on the east face of Hunk Rock.
